com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem
Class TraversePathIterable

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.BaseTraversePathIter
      com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.TraversePathIterable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<File>
@FullyTested
public final class TraversePathIterable
extends BaseTraversePathIter
implements Iterable<File>

Builder class for TraversePathIterator. This class divides directory traversal (which directories to descend) from path iteration (which paths to return from Iterator.next()). Independent control is provided for both groups.

Methods for directory traversal:

  • withOptionalDescendDirPathFilter(PathFilter)
  • withOptionalDescendDirPathComparator(Comparator)

Methods for path iteration:

  • withOptionalIteratePathFilter(PathFilter)
  • withOptionalIteratePathComparator(Comparator)

Example: Iterate all normal files (non-directories) in a directory tree. This is equivalent to the UNIX command: find $dir -not -type d

Author:
Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
See Also:
TraversePathDepthPolicy, BaseTraversePathIter

Field Detail

DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY

public static final TraversePathExceptionPolicy DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY
Used by the constructor to set the default exception policy for path iterators. The value is TraversePathExceptionPolicy.THROW.

See Also:
TraversePathIterable(File, TraversePathDepthPolicy), BaseTraversePathIter.getExceptionPolicy(), withExceptionPolicy(TraversePathExceptionPolicy)
Constructor Detail

TraversePathIterable

public TraversePathIterable(File dirPath,
                            TraversePathDepthPolicy depthPolicy)
Constructs an iterable with its required attributes and none of its optional attributes:
  • descend directory path filter
  • descend directory comparator
  • iterate path filter
  • iterate comparator

The exception policy is set to the default: DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY. It can be changed via withExceptionPolicy(TraversePathExceptionPolicy).

Parameters:
dirPath - root directory to traverse. Must not be null, but need not exist. Directory trees may be highly ephemeral, so the existance of this directory at the time of construction is not required.
depthPolicy - when to descend directories: first or last. Must not be null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if dirPath or depthPolicy is null
See Also:
withRootDirPath(File), withDepthPolicy(TraversePathDepthPolicy), withExceptionPolicy(TraversePathExceptionPolicy), DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY, withOptionalDescendDirPathFilter(PathFilter), withOptionalDescendDirPathComparator(Comparator), withOptionalIteratePathFilter(PathFilter), withOptionalIteratePathComparator(Comparator)
Method Detail

withRootDirPath

public TraversePathIterable withRootDirPath(File rootDirPath)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the root directory to traverse. If the depth policy is TraversePathDepthPolicy.DEPTH_FIRST, this directory will be the last path considered for iteration (depending upon the filter). The vice versa also holds true for TraversePathDepthPolicy.DEPTH_LAST: this directory will be the first path considered for iteration (depending upon the filter).

Parameters:
rootDirPath - root directory to traverse. Must not be null, but need not exist. Directory trees may be highly ephemeral, so the existance of this directory at the time of construction is not required.
Returns:
new iterable
Throws:
NullPointerException - if rootDirPath is null
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter.getRootDirPath()

public TraversePathIterable withDepthPolicy(TraversePathDepthPolicy depthPolicy)

Parameters:
depthPolicy - when to descend directories: first or last. Must not be null.
Returns:
new iterable

withExceptionPolicy

public TraversePathIterable withExceptionPolicy(TraversePathExceptionPolicy exceptionPolicy)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the exception policy. The default value is DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY.

Parameters:
exceptionPolicy - how to handle exceptions thrown during directory listings. Must not be null.
Returns:
new iterable
Throws:
NullPointerException - if exceptionPolicy is null
See Also:
DEFAULT_EXCEPTION_POLICY, BaseTraversePathIter.getExceptionPolicy()

withOptionalDescendDirPathFilter

public TraversePathIterable withOptionalDescendDirPathFilter(PathFilter optDescendDirPathFilter)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the optional descend directory path filter. This attribute filters directories before traversal, including the root directory: BaseTraversePathIter.getRootDirPath(). Use the second parameter, depth, in method PathFilter.accept(File, int) to easily control this case.

Example: 


 new PathFilter() {
     @Override
     public boolean accept(File path, int depth) {
         if (0 == depth) {
             return true;  // always accept the root directory
         }
         // else, apply different logic
     }
 }

If the path filter is null, then all directories are traversed. To combine more than one path filter, consider using PathFilterUtils.anyOf(Collection) or PathFilterUtils.allOf(Collection). To control which paths are iterated, see withOptionalIteratePathFilter(PathFilter).

Parameters:
optDescendDirPathFilter - path filter for descend directories. May be null.
Returns:
new iterable
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter.getOptionalDescendDirPathFilter()

withOptionalDescendDirPathComparator

public TraversePathIterable withOptionalDescendDirPathComparator(Comparator<File> optDescendDirPathComparator)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the optional descend directory comparator. This attribute sorts directories before traversal. If null, directories are not sorted before traversal. To combine more than one comparator, consider using ComparatorUtils.chain(Collection).

To control the order paths are iterated, see withOptionalIteratePathComparator(Comparator).

Parameters:
optDescendDirPathComparator - comparator to sort descend directories. May be null.
Returns:
new iterable
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter.getOptionalDescendDirPathComparator()

withOptionalIteratePathFilter

public TraversePathIterable withOptionalIteratePathFilter(PathFilter optIteratePathFilter)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the optional iterated paths filter. This attribute filters paths before iteration, including the root directory: BaseTraversePathIter.getRootDirPath(). Use the second parameter, depth, in method PathFilter.accept(File, int) to easily control this case.

Example: 


 new PathFilter() {
     @Override
     public boolean accept(File path, int depth) {
         if (0 == depth) {
             return true;  // always accept the root directory
         }
         // else, apply different logic
     }
 }

If the path filter is null, then all paths are iterated, including directories. To combine more than one path filter, consider using PathFilterUtils.anyOf(Collection) or PathFilterUtils.allOf(Collection).

To control which directories are traversed, see withOptionalIteratePathFilter(PathFilter). To control how directories are paths are traversed, see withOptionalDescendDirPathFilter(PathFilter).

Parameters:
optIteratePathFilter - path filter for iterated paths. May be null.
Returns:
new iterable
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter.getOptionalIteratePathFilter()

withOptionalIteratePathComparator

public TraversePathIterable withOptionalIteratePathComparator(Comparator<File> optIteratePathComparator)
Constructs a new iterable from the current, replacing the optional iterated paths comparator. This attribute sorts paths before iteration. If null, paths are not sorted before iteration. To combine more than one comparator, consider using ComparatorUtils.chain(Collection).

To control the order directories are traversed, see withOptionalDescendDirPathComparator(Comparator).

Parameters:
optIteratePathComparator - comparator to sort iterated paths. May be null.
Returns:
new iterable
See Also:
BaseTraversePathIter.getOptionalIteratePathComparator()

iterator
